input: The ‘Panchsheel Agreement’ for peaceful coexistence was signed between (CDS 2015-II)
explanation: Panchsheel Agreement was signed between India and China (29 April 1954) on the following principles - I. Mutual respect for each other’s territorial integrity and sovereignty. II. Mutual non-aggression III. Mutual non-interference in each other’s internal affairs. IV. Equality and mutual benefit and V. Peaceful coexistance.
